mysql

Interface Write

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBWrite

    public interface Write
    interface for writing data into a database
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Holger Ebhart

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] addAccount(java.lang.String name, long id, boolean isVer, int follower, java.lang.String location, java.lang.String locationParent, java.lang.String url, java.util.Date date, boolean tweet)
      insert an account into the database
      int writeDay(java.util.Date date)
      inserts a new date into the database
      int writeLocation(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String parent)
      inserts a new location into the database
      int writeRetweet(long id, int location, java.util.Date date)
      inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased

    • Method Detail

      • addAccount

        int[] addAccount(java.lang.String name,
               long id,
               boolean isVer,
               int follower,
               java.lang.String location,
               java.lang.String locationParent,
               java.lang.String url,
               java.util.Date date,
               boolean tweet)
        insert an account into the database
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the account as String
        id - the official twitter id of the account as long
        isVer - true if the account is verified, else false
        follower - the number of followers as int
        location - the location of the account as String
        url - the url of the verified user as String
        date - the date of the tweet as Date
        tweet - true if a tweet status object has been read, false if a retweets status object has been read
        Returns:
        integer-array with two results of the database requests. First is result for adding the account, second is for adding the tweet. Database-request result is 0 if request was successfully, 'other' if line 'other' has been modified (no success)

      • writeRetweet

        int writeRetweet(long id,
               int location,
               java.util.Date date)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the account who's tweet was retweeted as long
        location - TO COMPLETE 0 if non localizable
        date - the day when the retweet has been written as Date
        Returns:
        database-request result as Integer (0 if request successfully, 'other' if line 'other' has been modified (no success))
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • writeLocation

        int writeLocation(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String parent)
        inserts a new location into the database
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the location as String
        parent - the parent location of the current location as String
        Returns:
        database-request result as Integer (0 if request successfully, 'other' if line 'other' has been modified (no success))

      • writeDay

        int writeDay(java.util.Date date)
        inserts a new date into the database
        Parameters:
        date - the date to write into the database as Date
        Returns:
        database-request result as Integer (0 if request successfully, 'other' if line 'other' has been modified (no success))
